name: Manage Inactive Subsites
author: Marcin Pietrzak

sections.installation:
There are 3 ways to install this plugin:

The super easy way

  1. Log in to your WordPress Admin panel.
  2. Go to: Plugins > Add New.
  3. Type ‘Manage Inactive Subsites’ into the Search Plugins field and hit Enter. Once found, you can view details such as the point release, rating and description.
  4. Click Install Now. After clicking the link, you’ll be asked if you’re sure you want to install the plugin.
  5. Click Yes, and WordPress completes the installation.
  6. Network Activate the plugin.
  7. A new submenu Manage Inactive will appear in your Network Dashboard in “Sites” menu.

The easy way

  1. Download the plugin (.zip file) on the right column of this page
  2. In your Admin, go to menu Plugins > Add
  3. Select button Upload Plugin
  4. Upload the .zip file you just downloaded
  5. Network Activate the plugin.
  6. A new submenu Manage Inactive will appear in your Network Dashboard in “Sites” menu.
  7. A new menu Manage Inactive Subsites will appear in your Admin Menu.

The old and reliable way (FTP)

  1. Upload travelpress folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Network activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in Network Dashboard.
  3. A new submenu Manage Inactive will appear in your Network Dashboard in “Sites” menu.
sections.description: Allow automate handle status of inactive site in MultiSite installation.
